transaction: Rebecca opens a business bank account with £825 of her own money
explanation: When owner invests money, we debit Bank (asset increases) and credit Capital (owner's equity increases).
When receiving a loan, we debit Bank (asset increases) and credit Loan (liability increases).

transaction: Sells goods for £1,100, customer pays by bank transfer
explanation: For cash sales, we debit Bank (asset increases) and credit Sales (revenue increases).

transaction: Takes £425 from business bank account for personal expenses
explanation: When owner withdraws money, we debit Drawings (owner's equity decreases) and credit Bank (asset decreases).

transaction: Buys goods for resale £730 on credit from G. Sharp
explanation: For credit purchases, we debit Purchases (expense increases) and credit Accounts Payable (liability increases).

transaction: Sells goods on credit £1,800 to P. Bracewell
explanation: For credit sales, we debit Accounts Receivable (asset increases) and credit Sales (revenue increases).

transaction: Pays rent on business premises £340 by bank transfer
explanation: When paying rent, we debit Rent Expense (expense increases) and credit Bank (asset decreases).
When receiving payment from credit customer, we debit Bank (asset increases) and credit Accounts Receivable (asset decreases).
When paying a supplier, we debit Accounts Payable (liability decreases) and credit Bank (asset decreases).

transaction: Buys IT equipment for £1,450 by debit card
explanation: When buying equipment, we debit Equipment (asset increases) and credit Bank (asset decreases).
